item.title: TREE outside 53 Pembroke Road, 29th October
item.description:
The tree is outside 53 Pembroke Road. It is also next to a school gate where children and parents cue. The tree has berries that are dropping causing sliding with the leaves and a mess on the pavement and the property and wall of 53 Pembroke Road.. The tree is also too big now is overhanging. It is the wrong type of tree for a residential area. The birds do not eat the berries.!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance door doesn't close, 29th October
item.description:
The door to the building doesn't close - the latch that pulls the door to a close at the top has been disconnected. This has been an issue for a few weeks now and non-residents have been entering the building.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London

item.title: Broken man hole cover, 29th October
item.description:
One of the man hole covers outside number 82 Petts Wood Road has been broken for some time. It has continually got worse recently. So much so that my wife and l are experiencing dreadful nights sleep as the cars,lorries and buses are continually running over the cover and keeping us awake. Would you please address this problem sooner rather than later.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cut foliage and branches left by footpath near Kemnal Road end, 29th October
item.description:
A resident has sent us the following:- “Along the alleyway which runs from Green Lane to Kemnal Road, a lot of tree surgery has been carried out in the woodland near the derelict property called Foxearth. This work was requested by the residents of Acorn Close, as they were worried the trees would fall on their properties. The dead wood and foliage from the trees have not been removed, but are now piled up along the alleyway, and as the wood is dead and dry, it has become a hazard. It could easily be set on fire by vandals, and this could easily spread to the nearby properties, or through the woodland. I am therefore very concerned about the situation, and wonder if you are able to speak with the owner of the woodland, and impress the danger of the piles of dead wood being left in such close proximity to private homes.” Can you please investigate to see what can be done, if anything, and get back to me? Thanks Cllr Alison Stammers

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Acorn Close, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
